availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Lucretia Langley Browder in Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, on December 21, 1820. Father of John W. Browder, Thomas C. Browder, William F. Browder, Isham Browder, Ann J. Browder, James E. Browder, Lafayette Browder, and Harrison R. Browder. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 111A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 596.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 209B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County Marriages, Film #000557316, p. 42-3.
"Isham Browder Jr. (1799-1864)," Find A Grave, Memorial #68206401, accessed July 28, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/68206401.
